emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Full Development Automation
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously design, code, test, and deploy software, reducing human intervention to oversight and strategic decisions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces need for human coders in routine tasks, potentially leading to job displacement but also freeing up human creativity for higher-level tasks.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant advancements in AI reliability, security, and ethical guidelines to ensure fairness and accountability.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace Integration
emerging_technologies.description: A mesh of electrodes implanted in the brain to enhance cognitive functions and interface directly with digital devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for cognitive enhancement could lead to social stratification based on access to this technology; ethical concerns about privacy and autonomy.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ethical, legal, and health safety regulations will significantly delay widespread adoption.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Integration of quantum computing with blockchain to enhance security through quantum-resistant encryption.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could prevent future quantum computing threats to current cryptographic systems, ensuring long-term security for digital transactions.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on the maturity of quantum computing and the evolution of blockchain technology.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transport Systems
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles and public transport systems that operate without human intervention, optimizing traffic flow and reducing accidents.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: High adoption in urban centers with supportive infrastructure; slower in rural areas due to different challenges.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Predictive Maintenance
mainstream_technologies.description: Use of AI to predict equipment failures in various industries, reducing downtime and maintenance costs.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in manufacturing, logistics, and energy sectors.

epoch_themes.description: Technological advancements that automate expert-level tasks across various fields.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shifts job markets, requires new educational paradigms, and potentially increases economic disparities.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growing demand for AI ethics, reskilling programs, and universal basic income discussions.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on technologies that promote sustainability in digital practices.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Reduces environmental impact of digital infrastructure, promotes energy efficiency.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased regulatory focus on green technology, corporate sustainability commitments.
